docs.snippet: Brazilians rejoiced on Saturday when their nervy team edged past Chile to book a place in the World Cup quarter-finals in a nail-biting penalty shootout, while in the other last 16 game, James Rodriguez scored a stunning volley as Colombia downed...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazilians rejoiced on Saturday when their nervy team edged past Chile to book a place in the World Cup quarter-finals in a nail-biting penalty shootout, while in the other last 16 game, James Rodriguez scored a stunning volley as Colombia downed Uruguay.

headline.main: Brazil Edge Chile, Rodriguez Rocket Launches Colombia
headline.print_headline: Brazil Edge Chile, Rodriguez Rocket Launches Colombia

docs.snippet: If Costa Rica midfielder Michael Barrantes believes his small Central American country's national side is favored to reach the World Cup quarterfinals, he's not about to say so publicly.
docs.lead_paragraph: If Costa Rica midfielder Michael Barrantes believes his small Central American country's national side is favored to reach the World Cup quarterfinals, he's not about to say so publicly.

headline.main: Costa Ricans Downplay Favored Status vs. Greece
headline.print_headline: Costa Ricans Downplay Favored Status vs. Greece

docs.snippet: A sensational display from James Rodriguez fired Colombia into the World Cup quarter-finals for the first time on Saturday with the attacking midfielder scoring twice in a 2-0 victory over Uruguay including a contender for goal of the tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: A sensational display from James Rodriguez fired Colombia into the World Cup quarter-finals for the first time on Saturday with the attacking midfielder scoring twice in a 2-0 victory over Uruguay including a contender for goal of the tournament.

headline.main: Rodriguez Steals Limelight as Colombia Reach Last Eight
headline.print_headline: Rodriguez Steals Limelight as Colombia Reach Last Eight

docs.snippet: Moments after Colombia wrapped up its victory over Uruguay in the World Cup, a trio of Colombian drivers headed to the rain-soaked podium at the Grand Prix of Houston.
docs.lead_paragraph: Moments after Colombia wrapped up its victory over Uruguay in the World Cup, a trio of Colombian drivers headed to the rain-soaked podium at the Grand Prix of Houston.

headline.main: Huertas Leads Colombian Sweep of Houston Podium
headline.print_headline: Huertas Leads Colombian Sweep of Houston Podium

docs.snippet: Despite bringing the might of FIFA discipline down on Luis Suarez for biting an opponent, football's governing body has let plenty of other incidents go unpunished at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite bringing the might of FIFA discipline down on Luis Suarez for biting an opponent, football's governing body has let plenty of other incidents go unpunished at the World Cup.

headline.main: FIFA Keeping Punishments to a Minimum at World Cup
headline.print_headline: FIFA Keeping Punishments to a Minimum at World Cup

docs.snippet: Dejected but defiant, and still defending Luis Suarez.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dejected but defiant, and still defending Luis Suarez.

headline.main: Suarez Idolized, Not Blamed for Uruguay's Exit
headline.print_headline: Suarez Idolized, Not Blamed for Uruguay's Exit

docs.snippet: The Netherlands will put its perfect record on the line in the second round of the World Cup on Sunday, taking on a Mexico side aiming to reach the quarterfinals for the first time since hosting the 1986 tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Netherlands will put its perfect record on the line in the second round of the World Cup on Sunday, taking on a Mexico side aiming to reach the quarterfinals for the first time since hosting the 1986 tournament.

headline.main: Netherlands Face Mexico in 2nd Round of World Cup

docs.snippet: The World Cup is gaining record viewership across the United States, but New York may have the most varied fan base.

docs.snippet: After Brazil goalkeeper Júlio César had made two shootout saves, Gonzalo Jara hit the right post, and the ball bounced back across the mouth of the goal and safely away.
docs.lead_paragraph: After Brazil goalkeeper Júlio César had made two shootout saves, Gonzalo Jara hit the right post, and the ball bounced back across the mouth of the goal and safely away.
docs.abstract: Brazil beats Chile in penalty kick shootout, 3-2, after teams play to 1-1 draw through extra time in Round of 16.

headline.main: World Cup 2014: Brazil Survives Shootout Against Chile

docs.snippet: A long-shot bid to overturn or reduce the penalty will almost certainly not be heard until after the World Cup ends on July 13.
